description:
Calicivirus chicken/V0021/Bayern/2004 is a strain of calicivirus that has been identified in chickens. Caliciviruses are a family of non-enveloped, positive-sense, single-stranded RNA viruses that can infect a variety of vertebrate hosts, including mammals and birds.

The specific strain, Calicivirus chicken/V0021/Bayern/2004, was isolated from a chicken sample collected in Bayern, Germany, in the year 2004. Caliciviruses are known to cause various diseases in poultry, including diarrhea, vomiting, and respiratory distress.

The genetic and molecular characteristics of this particular strain, including its genome sequence and any unique genomic features, would require further detailed scientific investigation and analysis to provide a more comprehensive description.
